Interface AVLTreeInterface<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AVLTree

    public interface AVLTreeInterface<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean areCousins(T element1, T element2)
      For two nodes, if their distances to the root is the same and their parents are not the same, they are said to be "cousins".
      int balanceFactor(T data)
      Returns the balance factor of the node that stores the data given as parameter BalanceFactor: height(leftSubtree) - height(rightSubtree) You may assume that there will be one and only one node whose balance factor is calculated
      java.util.ArrayList<T> bfTraverse()
      Visits all the nodes in a breadth first manner.
      boolean contains(T element)
      Returns true if the object in the parameter is in the tree
      void delete(T element)
      Deletes the element in the parameter If tree does not contain the element in the parameter, no update is done on the tree
      int height()
      The height of a node is defined as the number of edges from the node to the deepest leaf.
      java.util.ArrayList<T> inOrderTraversal()
      Traverses the tree "in order".
      void insert(T element)
      Inserts the element in the parameter to the tree If tree already contains the parameter, no update is done on the tree
      boolean isEmpty() 
      int numElementsInRange(T lower, T upper)
      Returns the number of elements in the tree that are greater than lower and less than upper (bounds are not inclusive, i.e., not less than or equal to)
      int size() 

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the tree is empty

      • size

        int size()
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the tree

      • contains

        boolean contains(T element)
        Returns true if the object in the parameter is in the tree
        Parameters:
        element - Element to be searched
        Returns:
        Whether tree contains the parameter

      • insert

        void insert(T element)
        Inserts the element in the parameter to the tree If tree already contains the parameter, no update is done on the tree
        Parameters:
        element - Element to be added

      • delete

        void delete(T element)
        Deletes the element in the parameter If tree does not contain the element in the parameter, no update is done on the tree
        Parameters:
        element - Element to be deleted

      • height

        int height()
        The height of a node is defined as the number of edges from the node to the deepest leaf. The height of a tree is the height of the root.
        Returns:
        The height of the tree

      • inOrderTraversal

        java.util.ArrayList<T> inOrderTraversal()
        Traverses the tree "in order". This means, the left subtree of the node is traversed first. Then, the node itself is visited. Then, the the right subtree is traversed. The data in each node is added to an ArrayList as the node is processed. In other words, this ArrayList stores the order of visiting of the nodes in the tree
        Returns:
        An ArrayList that stores the "data" field in nodes visited

      • bfTraverse

        java.util.ArrayList<T> bfTraverse()
        Visits all the nodes in a breadth first manner. As nodes are visited, "data" fields are added to an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList that stores the "data" field in nodes visited

      • areCousins

        boolean areCousins(T element1,
                   T element2)
        For two nodes, if their distances to the root is the same and their parents are not the same, they are said to be "cousins". Of course, if one of the parameters is not in the list, they cannot be cousins.
        Returns:
        true if elements in the parameter are cousins, false otherwise

      • numElementsInRange

        int numElementsInRange(T lower,
                       T upper)
        Returns the number of elements in the tree that are greater than lower and less than upper (bounds are not inclusive, i.e., not less than or equal to)
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower limit
        upper - the upper limit
        Returns:
        the number of elements within the range

      • balanceFactor

        int balanceFactor(T data)
        Returns the balance factor of the node that stores the data given as parameter BalanceFactor: height(leftSubtree) - height(rightSubtree) You may assume that there will be one and only one node whose balance factor is calculated
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        balance factor of the node storing data
